title: What is the history of acoustic music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Exactly as Jay says.  Since the first Sapiens started banging on a hollow log or twanging a fire-bow...It's been acoustic all the way. Electronic amplification didn't even become possible until the late 20s and early 30s, and that primarily for normally-acoustic instruments so they could be heard in big-band settings. Consider this...All the great orchestral music of history has been "acoustic".
